msgSnippet: Shouldn t be difficult. Just have to add some command line parms that result in a call in to some existing methods. I ll try to get it scheduled for the next

Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's support of JUnit

From: "Michael Silverstein" <msilverstein@...>

Shouldn't be difficult. Just have to add some command line parms that result
in a call in to some existing methods. I'll try to get it scheduled for the
next release after this upcoming one. Working with Ant seems like a good
idea. We like the idea of integrating with and adding value to existing
tools, rather than reinventing the same functionality.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Erik Meade [mailto:emeade@...]
> Sent: Thursday, March 08, 2001 11:11 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's
> support of JUnit
>
>
> I for one would like to request a command line - text based
> version.  It would make it easier to create an Ant taskdef
> for.  I use Ant to automate building and testing on many of
> the projects I've worked, really a nice little tool.  You
> make want to consider using it in to automate your build/test
> environment.
>
> --
> Erik Meade             emeade@...
> Senior Consultant      Object Mentor, Inc.
> http://www.junit.org
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Michael Silverstein [mailto:msilverstein@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, March 08, 2001 6:59 AM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's
> > support of JUnit
> >
> >
> > That's a good question. I've just recently learned of Ant (through this
> > forum) and have added that very topic to my list of things to
> > look in to. I
> > imagine a command line interface would be a prerequisite for
> being able to
> > batch actions other than executing tests, which I believe you
> > would get for
> > free.
> >
> > ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> > Mike Silverstein, Lead Architect	voice:  (919) 858-8300 x29
> > SilverMark, Inc.			fax:    (919) 858-8308
> > 5511 Capital Center Drive		mobile: (919) 669-5906
> > Suite 510, Raleigh, NC 27606		toll free: (888) 588-0668
> > http://www.silvermark.com		msilverstein@...
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Hugo Garcia [mailto:elhugonyc@...]
> > > Sent: Thursday, March 08, 2001 8:44 AM
> > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate
> Test Mentor's
> > > support of JUnit
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > Would it be possible to integrate this tool with Ant?
> > >
> > > -H
> > >
> > > --- Michael Silverstein <msilverstein@...> wrote:
> > > > It depends. The tests are stand-alone Java classes, so you can
> > > execute them
> > > > as part of your build. If you want the code coverage, the
> > JPDA setup is
> > > > currently managed from the GUI, but I'm sure we could make it
> > > command-line
> > > > driven if somebody asked for it. The test generation (generate
> > > tests from
> > > > Rose design models, or class relationships) part is also driven
> > > from a GUI.
> > > > We are demand driven and very open to input, so if users
> > > indicated it would
> > > > be helpful for various aspects to be controlled from the
> > > command line we are
> > > > certainly open to adding that ability.
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

> > > >   >I threw together a screen capture to illustrate at:

> > > >
> > > >   Is there a command line version, or an interactive API?
> > > >
> > > >   I would probably want to integrate this tool into the build
> > > process, so I
> > > > need a way to automate the testing and results. That way I
> > can become a
> > > > build nazi, and notify the offending programmer every time

> > > > code that is not tested.
> > > >
